Class HelpersTest

java.lang.Object
tests.HelpersTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class) public class HelpersTest extends Object
Unit tests for the Helpers utility class.

This test class verifies the behavior of time retrieval, random code generation, and timestamp formatting, including edge cases such as zero-length codes and the Unix epoch.

Author:
Dhruv
See Also:

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    testFormatTimestampEpoch()
    Tests that Helpers.formatTimestamp(Timestamp) formats the Unix epoch (0 ms) as "12:00:00 01 Jan, 1970".
    void
    testFormatTimestampSpecificDate()
    Tests that Helpers.formatTimestamp(Timestamp) correctly formats a known timestamp value.
    void
    testGenerateRandomCodeAlphanumericOnly()
    Tests that Helpers.generateRandomCode(int, boolean) with highSecurity=false produces only alphanumeric characters of the correct length.
    void
    testGenerateRandomCodeWithSpecialCharacters()
    Tests that Helpers.generateRandomCode(int, boolean) with highSecurity=true produces characters only from the allowed set.
    void
    testGenerateRandomCodeZeroLength()
    Tests that Helpers.generateRandomCode(int, boolean) returns an empty string when length is zero, regardless of security flag.
    void
    testGetCurrentTimeInSeconds()
    Tests that Helpers.getCurrentTimeInSeconds() returns a value within one second of the system clock.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      @Test @Order(1) public void testGetCurrentTimeInSeconds()

      Tests that Helpers.generateRandomCode(int, boolean) with highSecurity=false produces only alphanumeric characters of the correct length.

      @Test @Order(4) public void testGenerateRandomCodeWithSpecialCharacters()
      Tests that Helpers.generateRandomCode(int, boolean) with highSecurity=true produces characters only from the allowed set.
